name: Vij’s Restaurant

name: Sula Indian Restaurant (Commercial Dr.)

name: Sula Indian Restaurant (Davie St.)
description: Second location of Sula, known for its coastal Indian cuisine and an ambitious menu of bold, uncompromising flavours:contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}.

name: Lila Vegetarian Indian Bistro
description: Modern Indian vegetarian restaurant by Meeru Dhalwala (of Vij’s) offering plant-forward dishes cooked in beautifully spiced braises:contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}.

name: East Is East (Main Street)
description: Fusion eatery inspired by the Silk Road, featuring Indian, Afghan, and Middle Eastern dishes in a cozy, cultural ambiance.

name: East Is East (Kitsilano)
description: Kitsilano outpost of East Is East, offering the same blend of Indian and Afghan cuisines with nightly live music and chai lounge vibes.

name: House of Dosas
description: Late-night casual eatery specializing in South Indian and Sri Lankan dosas (savory crêpes) with a huge variety of fillings:contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}.

name: Chutney Villa
description: South Indian & Sri Lankan restaurant offering homestyle curries, dosas, and street snacks in a cozy setting.

name: Salam Bombay
address: 755 Burrard Street (3rd Floor), Vancouver, BC V6Z 1X6
description: Elegant Indian restaurant in downtown Vancouver serving classic curries and tandoori fare in an upscale, spacious dining room.

name: Delhi Fusion Indian Cuisine
description: Casual Indian eatery on Robson offering a mix of North Indian curries and Indian street-food-inspired fusion dishes.

name: All India Sweets & Restaurant
description: Long-running vegetarian Indian restaurant and sweets shop in the heart of Punjabi Market, known for its inexpensive buffet and mithai (Indian desserts).

name: Punjabi By Nature Tiffin Service
description: Home-style Punjabi cooking offered via tiffin (meal) service and catering, delivering authentic taste for daily meals.

name: Tasty Indian Bistro (Yaletown)
description: Chic modern Indian restaurant bringing the famed Surrey-based Tasty experience to downtown; features stylish décor and refined Indian flavors:contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5}.

name: Tasty Indian Bistro (Delta/Surrey)
description: Flagship location of Tasty Bistro, famed for its upscale ambiance and extensive menu ranging from traditional Punjabi dishes to contemporary creations.

name: My Shanti (by Vikram Vij)
description: Vikram Vij’s Surrey restaurant featuring creative Indian dishes inspired by different regions of India, served in a vibrant, Bollywood-inspired setting.

name: Dhoom Restaurant & Bar
description: Upscale Indian restaurant and lounge featuring live entertainment and an eclectic menu of Indian and Indo-Chinese dishes, known for its weekend nightlife vibe.

name: Anmol Sweets & Catering
description: Popular Punjabi sweet shop and vegetarian restaurant offering a variety of traditional mithai (sweets), snacks, and North Indian curries.

name: Lahori Sweets & Restaurant
description: Pakistani Punjabi eatery known for its authentic Lahori-style snacks, halwa-puri breakfast on weekends, and a selection of sweets and desserts:contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6}:contentReference[oaicite:7]{index=7}.

name: Karakoram Restaurant
description: Authentic Pakistani restaurant offering traditional dishes from Lahore and Peshawar – from aromatic biryanis to succulent kebabs – in a family-friendly setting:contentReference[oaicite:8]{index=8}.

name: Dewan-E-Khass
address: 办法 - (Fraser Street at E 49th Ave), Vancouver, BC
description: Cozy Indian & Pakistani restaurant on Fraser Street known for its flavorful curries and grilled meats; a hidden gem for homestyle South Asian cooking:contentReference[oaicite:9]{index=9}.

name: Kabil Kashmiri Restaurant
description: Authentic Kashmiri/Pakistani restaurant featuring specialties like pulao, karahi, and grilled meats, with rich spices reminiscent of home-style cooking.

name: Afghan Horsemen Restaurant
description: Canada’s first Afghan restaurant (since 1974), offering traditional Afghan cuisine—kabobs, curries, and platters—in a carpeted, cushion-lined dining room evoking Afghan culture.

name: Afghan Kitchen
description: Modern Afghan restaurant combining traditional recipes with contemporary presentation – known for bolani, mantu dumplings, kebabs, and Afghan stews in a chic atmosphere.

name: Yak & Yeti Bistro
description: Nepalese and Himalayan cuisine restaurant known for its momos (dumplings), curries, and grilled dishes, offering a cozy taste of Nepal in Vancouver.

name: Cafe Kathmandu
description: A cozy cafe-restaurant serving Nepalese and Tibetan specialties (like momos, thukpa soup) along with regular live music and cultural events.

name: J.R. Taste of Ceylon
description: Unassuming Sri Lankan eatery offering authentic home-style dishes like kothu roti, string hoppers, and curries. A go-to spot for Sri Lankan comfort food:contentReference[oaicite:10]{index=10}.

name: Kurumba Restaurant
description: Casual restaurant serving Sri Lankan specialties along with some South Indian and other Asian dishes, known for its hoppers and spicy curries:contentReference[oaicite:11]{index=11}.

name: Shahlaal Sweets & Catering
description: Pakistani dessert parlour famous for its falooda, kulfi, and traditional sweets, also serving chaat, gol gappe, and other street snacks in a casual setting.

name: Sharmaji Cafe (Elaichi Chai)
description: A Marathi-inspired café serving authentic Mumbai street foods like vada pav, pav bhaji, and cutting chai in Vancouver:contentReference[oaicite:12]{index=12}.

name: Chai Ghai Café
description: Vancouver’s first authentic Indian chai café, family-owned and Ayurvedic-inspired, offering spiced milk teas and light snacks in a cozy downtown nook:contentReference[oaicite:13]{index=13}.

name: Chai Wagon (Food Truck)
description: A mobile chai tea wagon bringing authentic Indian masala chai and street snacks to farmer’s markets and events around Vancouver:contentReference[oaicite:14]{index=14}.

name: Punjabi Market Sweets (New India Sweets)
description: One of the original sweet shops in Vancouver’s Punjabi Market, offering a wide variety of Indian mithai (sweets) like gulab jamun, laddoo, barfi and fresh samosas.

name: Dhaliwal Sweets & Restaurant
description: Lively Indian sweet shop in Payal Centre offering an array of fresh mithai, plus a casual eatery section for chaat, chole bhature, samosas, and other snacks.

name: Fruiticana (Punjabi Market)
description: Popular Indian grocery chain outlet offering a wide selection of fresh South Asian produce, spices, lentils, and specialty ingredients from the subcontinent:contentReference[oaicite:15]{index=15}.

name: Punjab Food Center
description: Full-service Indian grocery store in Punjabi Market carrying spices, lentils, produce, and halal meats – a one-stop shop for South Asian cooking needs:contentReference[oaicite:16]{index=16}.

name: Super Spice House
description: Family-run grocery specializing in Indian, Fijian, and other South Asian spices and products, offering a large selection of spices, flours, and fresh produce:contentReference[oaicite:17]{index=17}:contentReference[oaicite:18]{index=18}.

name: Sabzi Mandi Supermarket
description: Large Indian supermarket chain known for extensive produce sections and South Asian staples; a go-to in Surrey for spices, lentils, and specialty South Asian foods:contentReference[oaicite:19]{index=19}.

name: Fruiticana (Surrey Payal)
description: Surrey outlet of the Fruiticana chain, located in the heart of Payal Business Centre, supplying local shoppers with fresh vegetables, fruits, and imported South Asian groceries:contentReference[oaicite:20]{index=20}.

name: Choose N Buy (Can-Kerala)
description: Retail outlet of Can-Kerala Imports, offering specialty groceries from South India, Sri Lanka, and Fiji – from spice mixes to dried fish – catering especially to South Indian and Sri Lankan communities:contentReference[oaicite:21]{index=21}.

name: Guruji Foods
description: Local Indian grocery and spice shop in Surrey offering a range of South Asian dry goods, snacks, fresh veggies, and halal meats (also known as Guru Foods).

name: Ajay Foods & Video
description: One-stop Indian grocery in Surrey supplying fresh vegetables, halal meat, spices, and a wide variety of snacks and packaged foods at affordable prices:contentReference[oaicite:22]{index=22}:contentReference[oaicite:23]{index=23}.

name: Gagan Foods (Retail Outlet)
description: Retail outlet for Gagan Foods (one of the largest South Asian grocery distributors in BC), offering bulk and retail South Asian food products and brands from India and Pakistan:contentReference[oaicite:24]{index=24}.

name: Teja World Foods
description: Factory outlet store for Teja Foods (a local Indian snack manufacturer), selling authentic Indian snacks (like chevdo, samosas, sweets) and a selection of Indian groceries at wholesale prices:contentReference[oaicite:25]{index=25}.

name: Exotic International Market
description: Retail outlet for the “Exotic” brand, famous for its samosas and ready-made Indian curries – carries frozen and fresh take-home Indian meals alongside typical Indian grocery items:contentReference[oaicite:26]{index=26}:contentReference[oaicite:27]{index=27}.

name: JJ Sri Lankan Store
description: Specialty grocery store focused on Sri Lankan products – from curry powders and spices to snacks and frozen foods – serving the Sri Lankan community in Vancouver:contentReference[oaicite:28]{index=28}.

name: Bombay Collection
description: Boutique offering a curated collection of Indian and Pakistani attire – including embroidered sarees, salwar suits, lehengas and groom’s sherwanis – popular for wedding shopping in Payal Business Centre.

name: Wellgroomed Designs
description: Luxury South Asian bridal boutique known for elaborate lehengas, gowns, and sherwanis. Offers custom-designed wedding outfits blending traditional craftsmanship with modern style.

name: Frontier Heritage (Vancouver)
description: One of Vancouver’s oldest Indian fashion stores, offering a wide selection of sarees, bridal lenghas, suits and fabrics. A staple of Punjabi Market for decades, known for its quality and custom tailoring.

name: Frontier Bridal (Surrey)
description: Surrey showroom of Frontier, specializing in bridal wear – from ornate bridal lehengas to custom sherwanis – attracting South Asian brides and grooms seeking luxurious wedding attire.

name: Crossover Bollywood Se
description: A high-end boutique offering Bollywood-inspired outfits and accessories. Carries designer anarkalis, gowns, menswear and even offers outfit rentals for performances and special events.

name: Lux Jewels & Suits
description: Specialty shop in Payal Centre known for men’s Indo-Western suits, sherwanis, and a selection of traditional jewelry. Popular spot for groom’s attire and accessories:contentReference[oaicite:29]{index=29}.

name: Gulzar Creations
description: Boutique specializing in Pakistani designer outfits – bridal gowns, formal suits, and party wear – with intricate handwork and contemporary designs, serving fashion-forward clients in Surrey:contentReference[oaicite:30]{index=30}.

name: Punjabi Market Collection
description: Affordable clothing store in Punjabi Market carrying everyday South Asian wear – from cotton kurtis and leggings to kids’ Punjabi suits – catering to daily wardrobe needs of the community.

name: Zanzibar Creations
description: Unique boutique blending South Asian and East African fashion influences, offering colourful khanga and sari fusion outfits, custom tailoring and East African-Indian bridal wear options.

name: Pink Orchid Studio
description: Renowned bridal makeup and hair studio offering luxury services for South Asian brides. Known for glamorous makeovers and its beauty academy training programs, serving clients by appointment:contentReference[oaicite:31]{index=31}.

name: Drama Queen Studios
description: One of BC’s longest-running South Asian bridal hair & makeup companies, led by artist Kiran Purewal. Offers in-studio and on-location services for bridal parties, as well as non-bridal styling:contentReference[oaicite:32]{index=32}:contentReference[oaicite:33]{index=33}.

name: Mona Beauty Salon
description: Full-service South Asian beauty salon offering eyebrow threading, waxing, henna (mehndi) application and bridal hair/makeup. A go-to for Vancouver’s South Asian community’s beauty needs.

name: Mehndi & Muskan Studio
description: Specialized henna art and makeup studio in Payal Centre. Offers intricate bridal mehndi designs, party henna, and professional makeup application for weddings and events.

name: Khalsa Diwan Society Sikh Temple
description: Historic Sikh gurdwara established in 1908, serving as a cultural and religious hub. Offers daily prayers, langar (community kitchen) and hosts Vancouver’s annual Vaisakhi parade celebrations.

name: Guru Nanak Sikh Gurdwara
description: One of the largest Sikh gurdwaras in BC, known for its active community programs. It hosts a busy langar hall and is the starting point of Surrey’s huge Vaisakhi parade each April.

name: Gurdwara Dasmesh Darbar
description: Sikh temple famous as the organizer of Surrey’s annual Vaisakhi parade (one of the largest outside India). A vibrant community gurdwara offering daily kirtan and langar services to all.

name: India Cultural Centre of Canada Gurdwara Nanak Niwas
description: Richmond’s prominent Sikh gurdwara on the famed ‘Highway to Heaven’ interfaith road. It doubles as a cultural centre, hosting kirtan programs and community events for the South Asian community.

name: Lakshmi Narayan Mandir (Hindu Temple)
description: The largest Hindu temple in Surrey, dedicated to Lord Vishnu and Lakshmi. This mandir offers daily worship services, Sunday kirtans, festivals (Diwali, Janmashtami) and a community hall for cultural events:contentReference[oaicite:34]{index=34}.

name: Hindu Temple Burnaby
description: One of the oldest Hindu temples in Canada (est. 1972), run by the Hindu Cultural Society of BC. A three-story temple that serves as a religious and community activity hub for Hindus in the Lower Mainland:contentReference[oaicite:35]{index=35}.

name: ISKCON Vancouver (Hare Krishna Temple)
description: Hare Krishna temple offering vibrant spiritual programs: daily aartis, kirtan, Bhagavad Gita classes, and a popular Sunday Feast that draws visitors for vegetarian prasadam:contentReference[oaicite:36]{index=36}:contentReference[oaicite:37]{index=37}.

name: Sri Ganesh Temple Society of BC
description: A Hindu temple in Vancouver devoted to Lord Ganesha and other deities, serving the South Indian Hindu community. Offers regular pujas, Tamil bhajans, and celebrates festivals like Ganesh Chaturthi with great fervor:contentReference[oaicite:38]{index=38}:contentReference[oaicite:39]{index=39}.

name: Vancouver Jain Center
description: A small Jain worship hall serving the Jain community in Metro Vancouver. Holds monthly prayer meetings, lectures on Jain philosophy, and annual celebrations for Mahavir Jayanti and Paryushan.

name: Vancouver Jamia Masjid
description: Also known as Al-Jamia Masjid, this is Vancouver’s oldest mosque (est. 1963) and a center for the Pakistani-Canadian community. Offers five daily prayers, Jummah services, and is nicknamed the “Traveler’s Mosque” for its central location:contentReference[oaicite:40]{index=40}.

name: Surrey Jamea Masjid
description: The largest mosque in Surrey, serving a diverse Muslim population (predominantly South Asian). Provides extensive community services including a Quran school, youth programs, and hosts Eid prayers drawing thousands of congregants.

name: Masjid Al-Salaam & Education Centre
description: Burnaby’s primary mosque, run by the BC Muslim Association, serving a large South Asian congregation. Features a school and library on-site, and actively engages in interfaith and outreach programs across Metro Vancouver.

name: Az-Zahraa Islamic Centre
description: A large Shia Imami Ismaili mosque and community centre in Richmond, serving primarily the Shia Muslim community (many of Southeast Asian origin). Features a distinctive architectural design and offers regular religious classes and civic engagement activities.

name: Vancouver Gujarati Samaj
description: Non-profit organization preserving Gujarati culture and language. Hosts Navratri garba events, Gujarati drama festivals, and community networking gatherings for the Gujarati diaspora in Metro Vancouver.

name: Punjab Cultural Association
description: Organization dedicated to promoting Punjabi arts, culture, and heritage. It organizes events such as Bhangra competitions, Punjabi folk music nights, art exhibitions and runs workshops on Punjabi language and gurbani music for youth.

name: South Asian Arts Society
description: A non-profit performing arts organization that produces events like the Monsoon Performing Arts Festival and offers classes in Bhangra, Bollywood dance, and theatre. Aims to bridge communities through South Asian arts and culture.

name: 5X Festival (VIBC)
description: Annual South Asian millennial youth culture festival (formerly Vancouver International Bhangra Celebration) featuring music, art, and fashion events. The organization also runs 5X Press, a digital magazine for South Asian youth, and year-round cultural programming.

name: Pakistan Canada Association (Pakistan House)
description: Established in 1963, PCA is the leading organization for Pakistani-Canadians in BC. Operates Pakistan House community centre and Vancouver’s Jamia Masjid, offering settlement services, cultural events (Independence Day, Eid Milan), and charitable initiatives for the community:contentReference[oaicite:41]{index=41}.
